citation.article-title: Rubellimicrobium mesophilum sp. nov., a mesophilic, pigmented bacterium isolated from soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rubellimicrobium mesophilum sp. nov.
Rubellimicrobium mesophilum [me.so.phi′lum. Gr. adj. mesos middle; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. neut. adj. mesophilum middle (temperature)-loving, mesophilic].
Cells are Gram-negative, motile, non-flagellated, irregular rods, 0.4–0.7×1.6–3.4 μm.
Colonies on R2A medium are pink to light reddish.
Oxidase and nitrate reduction activities are negative, whereas catalase activity is weakly positive.
Positive for starch and Tween 80 hydrolysis and assimilation of cellulose, histidine, leucine and fructose.
Tests for leucine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-glucosidase are positive (API ZYM; bioMérieux).
Growth is observed at 20–37 °C (optimum 28 °C) and at pH 7–11 (optimum pH 7.0±0.2); no growth in the presence of NaCl.
The major respiratory quinone is ubiquinone Q-10.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 72.3 mol%.
The type strain, MSL-20T (=KCTC 22012T =DSM 19309T), was isolated from soil from Bigeum island, Republic of Korea.
